result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mile Vasic

records.addlTxt:
8:37 AM Defendant Mile Vasic in court.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Mile Vasic. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense is swill awaiting blood test results, and requests another date in late November. Court sets.
Hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jack Rieder, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Mile Vasic in court, in custody, with attorney J Andrew Herbers.    

Parties are still waiting on the blood results/drug panel.
Also the defendant entered a plea and went to sentencing on 20CM1960 on 07/07/22 - Making this case now an OWI (3rd) - State will need to file an amended criminal complaint.
  Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Hearing on July 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Hearing on July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court will convert the $6,000 cash bail to a signature bond of $6,000
CONDITIONS:
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 3 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols.  Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.

Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Mile Vasic in court, in custody, with attorney J Andrew Herbers.   

Defense is prepared to proceed to trial.
State is still waiting on the drug panel results and requesting the court adjourn the trial.
Defense is requesting the court modify bond to a signature bond or dismiss this matter and have the state refile once they get the drug panel.
Court cancelled the jury trial


Court will modify bond.
Court will convert the $6,000 cash bail to a signature bond of $6,000
CONDITIONS:
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 3 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols.  Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.  Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.  Hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motions in Limine

Jury status hearing on June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

09:54 AM Defendant Mile Vasic in court, in custody, with attorney J Andrew Herbers.   Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense enters a speedy trial demand. Trial to be scheduling within 60 days.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
